oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage of a tomato plant, a homemade train, a police officer, a celebrity, a woman wearing a shawl, castle ruins, and a gubernatorial candidate. Nashville Banner, 1928 September 23.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Bond, R. W.; Hutchinson, L. H.; Hutchinson, Frank; Hutchinson, L. H., Jr.; Leclere; Trumbull, Florence; Labasin, Lydia; Hobbs, James; Morris, Charles G.
Nashville Banner
Gardens; Railroads; Children; Police; Women; Political elections; Celebrities; Ruins
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of a tomato plant grown in Bordeaux on Hyde's Ferry Pike, a homemade train built for children at 510 North Second Street, a Parisian police officer with a long beard, the President's son's fiance, a Italian fashion contest winner, ruins of an English castle, and the Democratic nominee for Connecticut governor. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Reaney, E. A.; Barr, W. E.; P. & A. Photo
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:relation: Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
